name: HB means "Huge Bioroids" - ver 1.2.2
description:
Easy strategy.

Wake up Huge Bioroids with combo cards (Effy Research, Over AI, Priority, Awake Center...); protect central servers and Director Haas.

Play test says it's quite good. ;)

name: Rielle ma belle - ver 2.0
description:
Pretty aggressive toolbox.

I made a lot of experimental games, changing cards and changing # of copies. This setting is balanced.

Yog.0 works great with Dinosaurus and Personal Touch.

"Dinosaur.0" - George Pig, brother of Peppa

name: Kyūdō Shadows
description:
The idea for this originally came from this post over on BGG: http://boardgamegeek.com/article/13076459#13076459 In it, anathomical describes a Weyland deck where he utilizes Archers and the fact that they're insanely expensive to break consistently. Being intrigued by this idea and wanting to see how it plays, I drew up a rough draft and played a couple of matches. The biggest problem was usually to score the first agenda so I could start up the Archer remote madness, so if I didn't draw into a Hostile, things could get very hairy. Other than that, the deck performed admirably.

And then it hit me - this can be built just as well, if not better in Jinteki! The agenda composition only needs minimal changes, with Clone Retirement taking the place of Hostile Takeover... and what's better, I can comfortably Trick-of-Light any other 1-pointer from out of hand to get the Archer train rolling, too! Similarly, I get better resilience to RnD digs by having Snares and the ID ability. The flatline "auto-win" isn't there yet, but I get more of an attrition aspect in return, by adding direct damage to the mix. Already having Shadows in the deck (for econ and ToL reasons) made Closed Accounts an auto-include, to complete the holy trinity of attrition - now I have program trashing, econ denial and direct damage.

The playstyle is relatively simple if you're familiar with Jinteki, only things to note would be:

  • always try to get the payoff from Corporate War, it gives an insane boost that will leave you free to spend time advancing ICE and doing all sorts of other interesting things
  • protect centrals with Shadows, the first Archer should probably go to a remote
  • advance Shadows as soon as it's practically feasible, both because of ToL and to make it impractically expensive to break
  • Chums are here for Femme protection (and to a lesser extent Inside Job protection) and to make Shadows a royal pain in the butt
  • Troubleshooter is here to cause trouble to Atmen and to possibly re-connect an Archer.
  • Also, Troubleshooter + Katana kills more people than you'd believe :P
  • Closed Accounts are here to make an unbroken Shadow more problematic and to send repeat Siphoners to the hell where they rightfully belong
  • Unorthodox Predictions should always say "Sentry" when scored

That's about all from me, thanks again to anathomical for the (indirect) inspiration!

p.s. in case anyone's wondering what Kyūdō is: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ky%C5%ABd%C5%8D

name: HB Juggernaut
description: Fast advance? More like last advance!! Work in progress. Feedback is appreciated.

name: Jinteki Ice Labrynth
description: Crazy Idea. Probably wont work. But the idea is to use Replicating Prefection to be able to have the time to build some /crazy/ ice labrynths on one or two remote servers, using Akitaro and over advanced Braintrusts to give you the economic edge.

name: Trash Consortium 0.1
description:
In my opinion, one of core elements of Android:Netrunner is: if the runner has the right icebreakers and enough credits he/she is capable to run at any server.

So, the basic idea of this deck is destroy runner's programs. Once the runner run out of icebreakers, a single Ice Wall is enough to secure a server (except against bypassing).

The main line of defense is Archer. With the Corporate Troubleshooter, Archer can be very hard to break.

Very cheap Ice can be useful to gain credit boost through Security Subcontract.

Aggressive Secretary and Power Shutdown helps to hurt the runner's rig.

I would like to hear suggestions and criticisms.

Thanks.

name: Kate, Ice Trasher
description:
I played Jinteki and got absolutely trashed by a deck a lot like this. Here's my version.

The idea is that you are going to run. A lot. You're going to take advantage of the Datasuckers and Parasites, using Imps to switch out Imps with Scavenge. It's event heavy, so there are 2x Same Old Thing and 1x Levy AR Lab Access just in case you need to reset.

Run so much that the corp stays broke. A broke corp isn't going to be doing any advancing at all. No advancing means you can freely index and keep running.

Any advice on what three cards to drop?

name: Reina Meltdown
description: First try in a Reina deck....work in progress

name: HB Juggernaut
description: Fast advance? More like last advance!! Work in progress

name: Red Reverse Cowgirl
description:
Deck Idea: My meta has made a competition for people to come up with Reina Archetypes, so I went for a tag-me approach. Thoughts behind this were: - Reina's ability is a pretty trickle-y but strong economy denial - Cards that help make ICE more expensive or de-rez will increase the effect - Imps are there for trashing tag-punishment or important Economy cards - Accessing and trashing as much as possible out of HQ should make Gorman Drips viable - I was thinking about Scrubber for even more and easier trashing, but is is a resource and it got cut somewhere along the way

Quick Start Guide: - Be sure to put pressure on HQ and trash Tag-punishment cards - If you got rid of closed accounts and/or SE, go Vamp - Joshua + Data Leak Reversal - Have a good ol' Mill-out

Current Status: Unplayed :-(

Current Thoughts: Is there enough economy? I'm thinking about losing the Criminal Events in favor of Program Tutoring for MO. Will play it a few times beforehand, though.

Thoughts, comments, anything appreciated.

name: Twist of Kate 0.1
description:
Pretty straightforward deck.

Search for icebreakers with Test Run, Self-modifying Code and Special Order to build the rig quickly. Heavy draw (Diesel and Quality Time) will help too.

Burst economy events (Dirty Laundry, Easy Mark and Sure Gamble) plus Magnus Opus and Kati Jones will provide the necessary credits for installing programas/hardware, playing events and using icebreakers.

The Toolbox, Cloak and Ice Carver also provide good economic support during the run.

I would like to hear suggestions and criticisms.

Thanks.
